climbs.name: Whiskers
climbs.fa: Bob Clark, Mike Lapierre, Franco Ghiggeri Sep. 1981

content.description: Begin at the start of a step-like, left-trending ramp.  Take the path of least resistance (and best pro) up the face to a bulge at the top.
content.protection: Small nuts and cams.  Trees at top for TR anchors.
content.location: Safest to rappel in and climb out.  There are also gullies to the left and right the right.  Pick your poison.

content.description:
Climb the prominent right-facing corner.  Requires some tricky stemming through the crux about 15 ft. up.  Originally 5.7R, it's harder now, probably due to exfoliated holds. 

  Be extremely careful of the large loose blocks near the top!
content.protection: Very limited pro.  Trees at top for TR anchors.
content.location: This route is the easiest to spot on the Southern Wall.  Safest to rappel in and climb out.  There are also gullies to the left and right the right.  Pick your poison.

content.description: Climb the face starting 4 feet right of the step-like, left-trending ramp.  Finish to the right of the bulge at the top.
content.protection: Recommend top-rope only.  Trees at top for anchors.
content.location: Safest to rappel in and climb out.  There are also gullies to the left and right the right.  Pick your poison.

content.description: Climb the face 5-6 feet right of the Tomcat corner.
content.protection: Recommend TR only.  Trees at top for anchors.
content.location: Safest to rappel in and climb out.  There are also gullies to the left and right the right.  Pick your poison.

content.description: There are a couple of decent lines on a small 25 foot wide face south of the Main Walls.  This area gets very little traffic and is covered in loose rock.  Be careful!
